MENINGOCOCCAL GROUP B VACCINE (RDNA, COMPONENT, ADSORBED)

VACCINES

  • Indications and doses
  • Side effects
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Immunisation against Neisseria meningitidis , primary immunisation,

By deep intramuscular injection

  • For children 2–5 months
    0.5 mL at least every 1 month for 3 doses, injected preferably into deltoid region (or anterolateral thigh in infants).

Immunisation against Neisseria meningitidis , primary immunisation booster dose,

By deep intramuscular injection

  • For children 1–2 years
    0.5 mL for 1 dose, injected preferably into deltoid region (or anterolateral thigh in infants).

Immunisation against Neisseria meningitidis , primary immunisation (in unimmunised patients),

By deep intramuscular injection

  • For adults
    0.5 mL at least every 1 month for 2 doses, injected preferably into deltoid region.
  • For children 6–11 months
    0.5 mL at least every 2 months for 2 doses, booster dose of 0.5 mL given between 1–2 years of age and at least 2 months after completion of primary immunisation, injected preferably into deltoid region (or anterolateral thigh in infants).
  • For children 12–23 months
    0.5 mL at least every 2 months for 2 doses, booster dose of 0.5 mL given 12–24 months after completion of primary immunisation, injected preferably into deltoid region (or anterolateral thigh in infants).
  • For children 2–10 years
    0.5 mL at least every 2 months for 2 doses, injected preferably into deltoid region (or anterolateral thigh in infants).
  • For children 11–17 years
    0.5 mL at least every 1 month for 2 doses, injected preferably into deltoid region.

Known side effects

General side effects

rare: Kawasaki disease in children, symptoms of meningitis reported (but no evidence that the vaccine causes meningococcal C meningitis),

notKnown: Unusual crying in children,

Prepared medicinal forms of MENINGOCOCCAL GROUP B VACCINE (RDNA, COMPONENT, ADSORBED)

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Suspension for injection
